item.title: Successful CEOs use ‘the rule of 5’ to create and keep new habits, says the career coach to the Fortune 500
item.description: If you can count to five, you have the tools to implement a change, says Bill Hoogterp.

item.title: How CEOs deal with Trump: Praise, face time, remorse, and gifts made of gold all go a long way, experience shows
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: A flood of AI deepfakes challenges the financial sector, with over 70% of new enrolments to some firms being fake
item.description: While AI presents an opportunity for financial firms like Ant International, it also poses risks.

item.title: Sea shares jump almost 20% after strong Q2, as CEO Forrest Li searches for new growth opportunities
item.description: The owner of the e-commerce platform Shopee reported quarterly revenue that jumped almost 40% year-on-year to reach $5.3 billion.

item.title: Cuomo accuses Mamdani of being a ‘very rich person,’ demands he ‘move out immediately’ from his rent-stabilized apartment
item.description: Mamdani earns $143,000 and has said he pays $2,300 per month for a one-bedroom apartment. Cuomo is a multimillionaire who moved to an $8,000-a-month m...
